title: Drawing, "Birth of the Virgin", 1650–75
medium: Pen and brown ink, black chalk on laid cream paper, lined
markings: verso: Brandegee stamp in violet, lower left mount: Lugt 1860c.
inscribed: recto in graphite, lower right mount: L. Giordano; verso in graphite, lower right mount: not written up / 1938.88.6550[symbol for check mark]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The virgin is seated on a raised platform in the center. She is holding baby Christ in her arms. Several figures attend to the Virgin, including a woman who kneels before her and washes the new mother's feet in a basin. Another woman is bringing the Virgin a basket of goods, which she carries on top of her head.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Birth of the Virgin", 1650–75.
1650–75. Pen and brown ink, black chalk on laid cream paper, lined. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6550.
